meanings.definition: The area outside of a city.
meanings.sent1: We went for a picnic in the outcity and enjoyed the fresh air.
meanings.sent2: The outcity is full of green fields and peaceful neighborhoods.
meanings.sent3: The outcity is like a big playground waiting to be explored.
meanings.sent4: Her mind wandered to the outcity of possibilities beyond the city limits.
meanings.sent5: The outcity stretched out before us, promising adventure and new experiences.

meanings.definition: To surpass in size or importance.
meanings.sent1: The new skyscraper will outcity all other buildings in the area.
meanings.sent2: His ambition is to outcity his competitors and become the top player.
meanings.sent3: The cake she baked seemed to outcity all previous baking attempts.
meanings.sent4: His generosity outcitys his wealth, making him truly admirable.
meanings.sent5: Her talent for storytelling outcitys that of any other writer I know.

meanings.definition: To leave or exit a city.
meanings.sent1: We decided to outcity the bustling city and head towards the countryside.
meanings.sent2: After a long day of work, all I wanted to do was outcity and relax at home.
meanings.sent3: The pigeons seemed to outcity the city as soon as the sun set.
meanings.sent4: As the train started to move, I felt the urge to outcity and explore new places.
meanings.sent5: The tourists were eager to outcity and discover the hidden gems of the town.
